Text: I remember coming across operation northwoods back in the late 1990s. And believe me, as chilling as this is (considering Bay of Pigs era thinking), there is worse out there.
Start back with the Creel Committee in WWI and work your way forward...
Ok I will take a look into it.  Thanks

I mention the Creel Committee because it was the first major successful use of advertizing and market research to not only sway but actually mold American opinion. It is as good a point to start as any. The insights they had in controlling and manipulating public opinion and perception was remarkable, and in many ways, "they" are still at it.

Also, don't forget to make use of the FOI (Freedom of Information) Act. You would be stunned to find out what you can (legally) learn by filling out a few forms and waiting for the mail to come in...
